reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We enjoyed this inn as it was very sociable and had a good atmosphere. The owners were helpful and happy types
reviews.title: Hope to come back

reviews.text: , The food was good as was the quality and selection of the ale. Good base for Dartmoor and the parking was no problem down the lane which was less than a minute away from the front door. Good location for Two Moors Way and Gastle Drogo and will go again when we are in the area . A TV would help in the room if only to watch MATD
reviews.title: By a lucky chance...

reviews.text: Comfortable beds as well
reviews.title: Enjoyable stay for the weekend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On our way from Cornwall to Bath, we chose to take the road through Dartmoor and by accident got of the B3212 on a road that led us to Sandy Park around lunchtime. There we saw this inviting inn. The food was good and the atmosphere friendly and familiar. Whenever we come back to Devon, we will try the rooms.
reviews.title: Charming pub with good food and comfortable rooms

reviews.text: Good beds clean rooms and hospitable staff have made my stay here a pleasure and I will be coming back again next year!
reviews.title: Quality local pub with decent food and reasonable rooms.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spent 2 great nights at the Sandy Park Inn. This pub has a warm feel and the room we stayed in was perfect for our needs. The location makes Dartmoor really accessible, with a lovely riverside walk just steps from the inn itself.
reviews.title: A lovely time

reviews.text: We stayed in room 4 which has its own en suite bathroom and was on the backside of the establishment. We couldn't hear any pub noise, and while we could hear the nearby road, we weren't bothered by it. Parking was easy and available on and around the inn grounds.
reviews.title: Wonderful Find for New Year's Eve

reviews.text: The owners are quite nice. The Rick Steves book mentions that the inn is owned by a "local bigwig", but that's no longer true. It's owned by family who run both the inn and kitchen.
reviews.title: Brilliant find!

reviews.text: We arrived on a Sunday and the owner made sure there was a dinner saved for us since it was off-season and many places would be closed. She also made a great recommendation for the Ring of Bells for dinner the next night just down the road in North Bovey.
reviews.title: you will not get a better breakfast!!!!!

reviews.text: The wifi worked really well and we were happy to see there wasn't a TV in sight, even in the pub. So many pubs have become overrun with noise and sports - Sandy Park retains a friendly, old fashioned pub atmosphere. Locals made us feel at home as we chatted about travel over our pints.
reviews.title: Comfortable, welcoming and homely!

reviews.text: Have stopped here for lunch before & it was very good. I think it has changed hands recently as some things have changed. We orderd 2 glasses of wine & had to ask the person behind the bar for a clean glass as she had poured it into a dirty glass and not noticed. The food was poor & not too much choice. We ordered a pub classic, steak & ale pie. It was tastless, very under seasoned not sure what the meat was but there were some very chewy lumps in it. There was hardly any "gravy" so the dish was quite dry.The seperate pie crust was bunt so much it was ineddible on one plate & scorched on the other. The pub was very quite so no rush on in the kitchen. It shouldnt have left the kitchen! Chips were frozen not hand cut as it says on the web site. The veg was fresh with a good selection.
reviews.title: poor lunch

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall it was a poor lunch,we wouldnt recomend it and we certainly wouldnt go back there.
reviews.title: we had a most enjoyable stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: our stay at the sandy park inn was wonderful. the staff were so friendly, the rooms were clean, we slept very well all in all we had a lovely few days. i can also recommend the food.
reviews.title: clean, comfortable and good food food, very relaxing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: .my partner and i came down from inverness for a family birthday. we had a most enjoyable stay. the food was like home cooking. the beds and bathrooms were immaculate. we would of liked a tv in the room. but everything else was perfect. thank-you.
reviews.title: Great weekend stay...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked this place after my Mum was in hospital in Exeter to save the to/fro journey over a bank holiday weekend. The satnav eventually got us to the place (better to use map and come down from the A30 if you're coming from Exeter). Found a small village pub with rooms - and a tiny bar full of friendly locals. Nice room but couldn't find the flat screen TV anywhere - not too much of a problem because we were only there for one night!! Great selection of beers on tap in the bar and excellent food from the kitchen and good service. Superb Fowey mussels and juicy lamb steak, with sensibly priced wines by the glass. Self service breakfast selection with whatever you fancy cooked afterwards - the bacon was superb. The location makes this place a great place for visiting DArtmoore attractions, walks etc as well as Castle Drogo which is literally across the road and up a hill. Great little place with great local food and good value.
reviews.title: Wonderful relaxing stay, staff could not be more accommodating

reviews.text: We have just returned from a 1 night stay at the Sandy Park Inn. It is perfectly located for beautiful (easy) walking, and the pub itself was everything that we hoped it would be. Very clean, very friendly, excellent food, lovely open fire, small bar with a nice atmosphere, very good beer. Thank you Matt & Shona for a lovely stay.
reviews.title: Everything we hoped it would be

reviews.text: There's good and bad. Very friendly helpful staff. Room nice size and clean with super comfy bed and good quality linen. Locals friendly in this old fashioned charming pub and food okay. Downside is its on a busyish road and traffic does come past in the night and the odd car whooshing by woke me up. And the building generally is tired with window sills in need of renovation and exterior of building generally well overdue some maintenance and TLC. The interior of the rooms has been painted but behind the paint the walls is woodchip wallpaper and the walls are cracking in places.
reviews.title: Honest British pub

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just had 2 nights here. It is very small and 'Olde Worlde' and is dog friendly. Has a good range of beers and a super restaurant menu. Staff and locals are very friendly and make you most welcome. Good place to stay for North Dartmoor and is very close to Castle Drogo (NT) and the Teign Valley.
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were disappointed with our stay for a number of reasons. Parking is difficult, we had to leave our car in a narrow country lane. Our room, the only en suite, had a few problems, the window didn't shut properly, no TV reception, only 1 cup, no spoon on the refreshments tray. Unable to reserve a table for the evening meal, fully booked by locals. Remember to tell the bar staff the night before what time you want breakfast, we forgot the 2nd night and got up before the staff had arrived. It was quite an experience to wander round the bar cluttered with the previous night debris, including ash trays, and wait for the staff to arrive......
reviews.title: Disappointed

reviews.text: I happened on the Sandy Park Inn with some friends as we were traveling to Cornwall and stopped for the night on a recommendation from a fully-booked pub / B & B owner in the next town.
reviews.title: Great Little Getway
